newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turk opposition leader agrees on new govt plan.
newsitem.headline: Turk opposition leader agrees on new govt plan.

text.p: The leader of Turkey's main opposition party said on Tuesday he was in full agreement with dissident government deputy Yalim Erez on forming a coalition excluding the ruling Islamists.

"We are in full agreement with Erez. We will press the button this week," Motherland Party leader Mesut Yilmaz told reporters after talks with conservative Erez in reference to plans to topple the government.
Erez was to hold further talks with a leftist leader later on Tuesday on forming an alternative coalition that would keep out the Islamist Welfare Party of Prime Minister Necmettin Erbakan.
Erez told reporters after meeting Yilmaz that he planned to discuss his coalition proposal as soon as possible with the leader of his True Path Party (DYP), Tansu Ciller.

"There is no obstacle in the way of forming an alternative government," said former trade and industry minister Yalim Erez, who resigned last month in protest at the Islamists' failure to back an army-led crackdown on religious activism.
Another dissident DYP deputy warned on Monday of action to bring down the 10-month-old coalition if the party did not support the alternative coalition proposal.
